recipes.name: Asian Scrambled Eggs
instructions: In a bowl, beat the eggs with soy sauce, sesame oil, green onions, salt, and pepper.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and pour in the egg mixture.
Stir continuously until the eggs are cooked to your desired consistency.
Serve hot with steamed rice or toast.

recipes.name: Western Omelette
instructions: In a bowl, beat the eggs with salt and pepper.
Melt butter in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Add the diced bell peppers and onions, and sauté until they are tender.
Pour the beaten eggs into the pan and cook until the edges start to set.
Sprinkle shredded cheese on one half of the omelette and fold it over.
Cook for another minute or until the cheese melts.
Serve hot with toast or a side of salad.

recipes.name: Congee
ingredients: Chopped green onions and cilantro for garnish
instructions: In a large pot, bring the rice and broth to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 1 hour or until the rice breaks down and the congee thickens.
Add the shredded chicken, grated ginger, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Stir well and cook for another 10 minutes.
Garnish with chopped green onions and cilantro before serving.

recipes.name: Pancakes
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix; lumps are fine.
Heat a non-stick griddle or frying pan over medium heat.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the griddle for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for another minute or until golden brown.
Serve hot with maple syrup, fresh fruits, or whipped cream.

recipes.name: Egg Fried Rice
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the beaten eggs and scramble until they are just cooked. Remove from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, add the mixed vegetables and stir-fry until they are tender.
Add the cooked rice and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes.
Pour in the soy sauce and mix well. If desired, add cooked shrimp or chicken.
Add the scrambled eggs back to the pan and toss everything together.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot.

recipes.name: French Toast
ingredients: Maple syrup and fresh berries for serving
instructions: In a shallow bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, vanilla extract, and cinnamon.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat and melt some butter.
Dip each slice of bread into the egg mixture, coating both sides evenly.
Place the dipped bread slices onto the hot pan and cook until golden brown on both sides.
Repeat with the remaining bread slices, adding more butter to the pan as needed.
Serve hot with maple syrup and fresh berries.

recipes.name: Dim Sum Steamed Buns
ingredients: 1/2 cup filling of your choice (e.g., pork, chicken, vegetables)
instructions: In a small bowl, dissolve the sugar and yeast in warm water. Let it sit for 5 minutes or until foamy.
In a large bowl, mix together the flour and salt. Make a well in the center and pour in the yeast mixture and vegetable oil.
Stir until a dough forms, then transfer to a floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes or until smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours or until doubled in size.
Punch down the dough and divide it into small pieces. Roll each piece into a circle and place a spoonful of filling in the center.
Fold the edges of the dough towards the center and pinch to seal. Place the buns on a steamer tray.
Steam the buns for about 15-20 minutes or until cooked through and puffy.
Serve hot as a dim sum breakfast or snack.

recipes.name: Eggs Benedict
instructions: Place the toasted English muffin halves on a serving plate.
Top each muffin half with a slice of Canadian bacon.
Carefully place a poached egg on top of each bacon slice.
Drizzle Hollandaise sauce over the eggs.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Japanese Tamagoyaki
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, soy sauce, mirin, sugar, and salt.
Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat and add the vegetable oil.
Pour a thin layer of the egg mixture into the pan and tilt the pan to spread it evenly.
When the bottom layer is set but still slightly runny on top, start rolling it up from one end of the pan to the other.
Push the rolled omelette to one end of the pan and oil the empty space.
Pour another thin layer of the egg mixture into the pan, lifting the rolled omelette to let the mixture flow underneath.
Repeat the rolling and pouring process until all the egg mixture is used.
Remove the rolled omelette from the pan and let it cool slightly.
Slice the tamagoyaki into bite-sized pieces and serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Belgian Waffles
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix; lumps are fine.
Preheat a waffle iron and lightly grease it.
Pour the batter onto the hot waffle iron and cook according to the manufacturer's instructions, usually until golden brown and crispy.
Serve the waffles hot with your favorite toppings, such as syrup, whipped cream, or fresh fruits.

recipes.name: Chinese Rice Noodle Rolls
ingredients: Soy sauce and hoisin sauce for serving
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together the rice flour, cornstarch, salt, and water until smooth.
Pour the mixture into a greased baking dish and steam over high heat for 10-15 minutes or until set.
Remove the steamed rice noodle sheet from the dish and let it cool slightly.
Cut the sheet into long strips, about 3-4 inches wide.
Top each strip with chopped green onions, cilantro, and fried shallots.
Roll up the strips tightly and cut them into bite-sized pieces.
Serve the rice noodle rolls with soy sauce and hoisin sauce for dipping.

recipes.name: Huevos Rancheros
instructions: Heat a skillet over medium heat and lightly toast the corn tortillas on both sides.
In the same skillet, cook the eggs to your desired doneness.
Place a tortilla on a serving plate and top it with black beans, salsa, and a cooked egg.
Sprinkle shredded cheese and chopped cilantro on top.
Repeat with the remaining tortilla, beans, salsa, egg, cheese, and cilantro.
Serve the huevos rancheros hot.

recipes.name: Miso Soup
instructions: In a saucepan, heat the dashi over medium heat until hot.
In a small bowl, whisk together the miso paste and a ladleful of hot dashi until smooth.
Pour the miso mixture back into the saucepan and stir well.
Add the cubed tofu and simmer for a few minutes until heated through.
Divide the soup into bowls and garnish with sliced green onions and seaweed, if desired.
Serve hot, and season with soy sauce according to taste.

recipes.name: Pad Thai
instructions: Soak the rice noodles in warm water until they are soft, then drain and set aside.
In a wok or large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic and diced tofu, and stir-fry until the tofu is golden brown.
Push the tofu to one side of the wok and pour the beaten eggs into the other side. Scramble the eggs until they are just cooked.
Add the soaked rice noodles to the wok, along with bean sprouts, chopped green onions, and chopped peanuts. Stir-fry for a few minutes until the noodles are heated through.
In a small bowl, whisk together the fish sauce, tamarind paste, sugar, and chili powder. Pour the sauce over the noodles and tosseverything together until well combined.
Serve hot with lime wedges for squeezing over the noodles.

recipes.name: English Breakfast
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Place the sausages, bacon strips, tomato halves, and mushrooms on a baking sheet.
Drizzle with oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and roast in the oven for about 20 minutes or until cooked through.
In a saucepan, heat the baked beans over medium heat until hot.
In a separate non-stick pan, melt some butter and fry the eggs to your desired doneness.
Toast the bread slices and spread with butter.
Serve the roasted sausages, bacon, tomato, mushrooms, baked beans, fried eggs, and toast together as a traditional English breakfast.

recipes.name: Thai Coconut Pancakes
ingredients: Maple syrup or condensed milk for serving
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Add the coconut milk, water, and vanilla extract to the dry ingredients. Stir until well combined.
Fold in the sweetened shredded coconut.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat and melt some butter or oil.
Pour about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the hot pan for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for another minute or until golden brown.
Serve the coconut pancakes hot with maple syrup or condensed milk.

recipes.name: Korean Kimchi Fried Rice
instructions: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
Add the diced onion, carrot, peas, and minced garlic. Stir-fry until the vegetables are tender.
Add the chopped kimchi and cook for another minute.
Add the cooked rice to the skillet and break up any clumps with a spatula.
Pour in the kimchi juice, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Stir-fry until the rice is well coated and heated through.
Remove from heat and stir in the chopped green onions.
Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and serve hot.

recipes.name: Croissant
instructions: In a small bowl, dissolve the sugar and yeast in warm milk. Let it sit for 5 minutes or until foamy.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour and salt. Cut the cold butter into small pieces and mix it into the flour using a pastry cutter or your fingertips until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Pour the yeast mixture into the flour mixture and stir until a dough forms.
Transfer the dough to a floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes or until smooth and elastic.
Shape the dough into a ball and place it in a greased bowl. Cover with a damp cloth and let it rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours or until doubled in size.
Punch down the dough and roll it out into a rectangle on a floured surface.
Place small pieces of cold butter on two-thirds of the dough and fold the remaining third over the buttered portion. Fold the other end of the dough over the folded portion, like a letter.
Roll out the dough again into a rectangle and repeat the folding process. Repeat this process two more times, then wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Remove the dough from the refrigerator and roll it out into a large rectangle. Cut the dough into triangles.
Roll each triangle from the wider end towards the tip to form a croissant shape.
Place the croissants on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Brush the croissants with beaten egg and let them rise in a warm place for 30-60 minutes or until puffed.
Bake the croissants in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.
Dust the croissants with powdered sugar before serving.

recipes.name: Vietnamese Pho
ingredients: Bean sprouts, basil leaves, lime wedges, and sliced chili peppers for garnish
instructions: In a large pot, bring the broth to a boil.
Add the onion, ginger, star anise, cinnamon sticks, cloves, and fish sauce. Simmer for about 30 minutes to infuse the flavors.
Meanwhile, cook the rice noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and set aside.
If using meat, thinly slice it and set aside.
Strain the broth to remove the solids and return it to the pot.
If using meat, briefly cook it in the hot broth until just cooked through.
Divide the cooked ricenoodles among serving bowls. Top with the sliced meat, if using.
Ladle the hot broth over the noodles and meat.
Garnish with bean sprouts, basil leaves, lime wedges, and sliced chili peppers.
Serve the pho hot, allowing each person to add their desired garnishes and seasonings.

recipes.name: American Pancakes
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, milk, egg, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix; lumps are fine.
Heat a non-stick griddle or frying pan over medium heat.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the griddle for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for another minute or until golden brown.
Serve the pancakes hot with your favorite toppings, such as maple syrup, fresh fruits, or whipped cream.

recipes.name: Indian Masala Dosa
ingredients: Coconut chutney and sambar for serving
instructions: Rinse the rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds together and soak them in water for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Drain the soaked rice, dal, and fenugreek seeds. Grind them together in a blender or food processor until you get a smooth batter. Add water as needed.
Transfer the batter to a large bowl, cover with a cloth, and let it ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.
After fermentation, the batter will be slightly sour and bubbly.
Stir the batter well and add salt to taste. Mix thoroughly.
Heat a non-stick griddle or dosa pan over medium heat. Grease it lightly with oil or ghee.
Pour a ladleful of batter onto the center of the hot griddle. Using the back of the ladle, spread the batter in a circular motion to form a thin dosa.
Drizzle a little oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa and cook until it turns golden brown and crispy.
Flip the dosa and cook the other side for a minute or until it is cooked through.
Remove the dosa from the griddle and place a portion of potato masala on one side of the dosa.
Fold the dosa in half or roll it up. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

recipes.name: German Brötchen
ingredients: Poppy seeds or sesame seeds for sprinkling
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour and salt.
In a separate small bowl, dissolve the yeast and sugar in lukewarm water. Let it sit for 5 minutes or until foamy.
Pour the yeast mixture and melted butter into the flour mixture. Stir until a dough forms.
Transfer the dough to a floured surface and knead for about 10 minutes or until smooth and elastic.
Shape the dough into a ball and place it in a greased bowl. Cover with a damp cloth and let it rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours or until doubled in size.
Punch down the dough and divide it into equal-sized portions.
Shape each portion into a small round roll.
Place the rolls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, leaving enough space between them for rising.
Cover the rolls with a damp cloth and let them rise for another 30-60 minutes or until puffed.
Preheat the oven to 220°C (425°F).
Brush the rolls with water and sprinkle them with poppy seeds or sesame seeds.
Bake the rolls in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove the rolls from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack.
Serve the Brötchen warm or at room temperature with butter or your favorite spreads.

recipes.name: Chinese Steamed Buns (Baozi)
ingredients: 1/2 cup filling of your choice (e.g., pork, chicken, vegetables)
instructions: In a small bowl, dissolve the sugar and yeast in lukewarm water. Let it sit for 5 minutes or until foamy.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour and salt.
Pour the yeast mixture and vegetable oil into the flour mixture. Stir until a dough forms.
Transfer the dough to a floured surface and knead for about 10 minutes or until smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours or until doubled in size.
Punch down the dough and divide it into equal-sized portions. Shape each portion into a small round ball.
Flatten each ball with your palm and use a rolling pin to roll it out into a circle about 3 inches in diameter.
Place a spoonful of filling in the center of each circle. Gather the edges of the circle and pinch them together to seal, creating a bun shape.
Place the buns on a greased steamer tray, leaving enough space between them for rising.
Cover the buns with a damp cloth and let them rise for another 30-60 minutes or until puffed
Fill a steamer pot with water and bring it to a boil. Place the steamer tray with the buns on top of the pot, making sure the water does not touch the buns.
Steam the buns for about 15-20 minutes or until cooked through and puffy.
Remove the steamed buns from the pot and let them cool slightly before serving.
Enjoy the Chinese steamed buns (baozi) warm with your favorite dipping sauce or condiments.

recipes.name: Spanish Tortilla
instructions: In a large non-stick frying pan, heat enough olive oil to cover the bottom of the pan over medium heat.
Add the sliced potatoes and onions to the pan and cook, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are tender and lightly golden.
In a bowl, beat the eggs with salt and pepper.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the cooked potatoes and onions to the beaten eggs and mix well.
Remove any excess oil from the pan, leaving only a thin coating.
Pour the egg and potato mixture back into the pan and spread it evenly.
Cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until the bottom is set.
Place a large plate or lid over the pan and carefully flip the tortilla onto the plate.
Slide the tortilla back into the pan to cook the other side for another 3-5 minutes or until cooked through.
Remove the tortilla from the pan and let it cool slightly before slicing.
Serve the Spanish tortilla warm or at room temperature as a delicious breakfast or tapas dish.

recipes.name: Thai Mango Sticky Rice
instructions: Soak the glutinous rice in water for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Drain the soaked rice and steam it in a rice cooker or steamer until it is tender and cooked through.
While the rice is cooking, prepare the coconut sauce by combining the coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a saucepan. Heat the mixture over medium heat until the sugar dissolves, but do not let it boil.
Remove the cooked rice from the steamer and transfer it to a bowl. Pour the coconut sauce over the rice and stir well to coat the rice evenly.
Let the rice sit for about 15-20 minutes to absorb the coconut sauce.
Peel and slice the ripe mangoes.
To serve, place a portion of the coconut sticky rice on a plate and top it with sliced mangoes.
Sprinkle toasted sesame seeds over the rice and mangoes for garnish.
Enjoy the Thai mango sticky rice as a sweet and delightful breakfast or dessert.

recipes.name: American Breakfast Burrito
ingredients: Hot sauce or salsa for serving
instructions: Warm the flour tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave until pliable.
In a bowl, season the scrambled eggs with salt and pepper.
Divide the scrambled eggs, crumbled bacon, shredded cheddar cheese, diced tomatoes, onions, bell peppers, and chopped cilantro among the tortillas.
Fold the sides of each tortilla inward, then roll it up tightly to form a burrito.
Optional: Heat a skillet over medium heat and lightly toast the burritos on all sides until the cheese melts and the tortillas turn golden brown.
Serve the breakfast burritos hot with hot sauce or salsa on the side.
